title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open and a .txt file is opened and edited, shutting down Windows without saving the file causes the loss of the changes in the .txt file. The affected platform is Windows. Other Windows programs like Word and Outlook may also be affected.
EB: When shutting down Windows with unsaved changes in a WSWB session, a warning or confirmation message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their files before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project.
3. Add a line of text to the text file.
4. Observe that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
5. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down/reboot the computer.
6. Verify that a warning or confirmation message box is displayed, allowing users to save their files before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
